Test Name: Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing (AST) for Nocardia species and other aerobic actinomycetes
Specimen Type: Pure culture isolates of Nocardia species and other aerobic actinomycetes
Purpose: To determine the antimicrobial susceptibility profile of Nocardia species and other aerobic actinomycetes to guide clinical therapy.
Container: Mueller-Hinton agar plate supplemented with 5% sheep blood
Equipment: Bacteriological incubator (35–37 °C), Mueller-Hinton agar plates with 5% sheep blood, antimicrobial discs or MIC testing plates, microbial identification system (e.g., MALDI-TOF MS), calibrated inoculating loops and sterile swabs
